Braden Assessment.Prompt: Assess the patient's sensory perception based on their ability to respond to stimuli. Rate from 1 (completely limited) to 4 (no impairment).
Assess the patient's moisture level based on the frequency of moisture exposure. Rate from 1 (constantly moist) to 4 (rarely moist).
Assess the patient's activity level based on their ability to move. Rate from 1 (bedfast) to 4 (walks frequently).
Assess the patient's mobility based on their ability to move. Rate from 1 (completely immobile) to 4 (no limitation).
Assess the patient's nutrition based on their current dietary intake. Rate from 1 (very poor) to 4 (excellent).
Assess the patient's risk of friction and shear based on their mobility and activity level. Rate from 1 (problem) to 3 (no apparent problem).

Calculate the patient's overall Braden score by summing the scores of sensory perception, moisture, activity, mobility, nutrition, and friction/shear. The total score ranges from 4 to 20, with lower scores indicating higher risk of pressure ulcers.

Extract the patient's wound bed percent granulation.
Extract the patient's wound bed percent slough.
Extract the patient's wound bed percent eschar dry.
Extract the patient's wound bed percent eschar wet.
Extract the patient's wound bed percent foreign body.
Options: 0% - No foreign body present; wound bed clean
25% - Small portion of wound bed contains foreign material
50% - Moderate amount of foreign material covering the wound bed
75% - Majority of wound bed contains foreign material
100% - Entire wound bed is covered by foreign material or objects

Incision/Wound/Skin/Pin site.Prompt: Extract the patient's wound bed percent underlying structures.
Options: 0% - Granulation or epithelial tissue, no underlying structures visible
25% - Small portion of bone, tendon, or other underlying structures visible
50% - Significant portion of the wound bed exposes underlying structures
75% - Most of the wound bed exposes bone, tendon, or other structures
100% - Entire wound bed exposes underlying structures such as bone, tendon, or muscle
